alert.note: Alert for Dickens (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:47PM CDT until September 11 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL DICKENS...KING AND NORTHEASTERN STONEWALL COUNTIES... At 546 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Guthrie, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 529 PM CDT, a wind gust of 64 mph was measured by the mesonet in Guthrie. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Guthrie, Old Glory, Swenson, and US-380 near the Haskell-Stonewall County Line. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
